verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 8:112
verses.text: Thus anciently, the people of the Jews, when they came out of affliction into a state of ease, kept the feast, staging a song of praise for their victory.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 8:113
verses.text: So also the people in the time of Esther, because they were delivered from the edict of death, kept a feast to the Lord, reckoning it a feast, returning thanks to the Lord, and praising Him for having changed their condition.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 8:114
verses.text: Therefore let us, performing our vows to the Lord, and confessing our sins, keep the feast to the Lord, in conversation, moral conduct, and manner of life; praising our Lord, Who hath chastened us a little, but hath not utterly failed nor forsaken us, nor altogether kept silence from us.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 8:115
verses.text: For if, having brought us out of the deceitful and famous Egypt of the opponents of Christ, He hath caused us to pass through many trials and afflictions, as it were in the wilderness, to His holy Church, so that from hence, according to custom, we can send to you, as well as receive letters from you; on this account especially I both give thanks to God myself, and exhort you to thank Him with me and on my behalf, this being the Apostolic custom, which these opponents of Christ, and the schismatics, wished to put an end to, and to break off.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 8:116
verses.text: The Lord did not permit it, but both renewed and preserved that which was ordained by Him through the Apostle, so that we may keep the feast together, and together keep holy-day, according to the tradition and commandment of the fathers.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 8:117
verses.text: We begin the fast of forty days on the nineteenth of the month Mechir (Feb.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 8:118
verses.text: ); and the holy Easter-fast on the twenty-fourth of the month Phamenoth (Mar.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 8:120
verses.text: We cease from the fast on the twenty-ninth of the month Phamenoth (Mar.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 8:121
verses.text: ), late in the evening of the seventh day.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 8:122
verses.text: And we thus keep the feast on the first day of the week which dawns on the thirtieth of the month Phamenoth (Mar.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 8:123
verses.text: ); from which, to Pentecost, we keep holy-day, through seven weeks, one after the other.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 8:124
verses.text: For when we have first meditated properly on these things, we shall attain to be counted worthy of those which are eternal, through Christ Jesus our Lord, through Whom to the Father be glory and dominion for ever and ever, Amen.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 8:125
verses.text: Greet one another with a holy kiss, remembering us in your holy prayers.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 8:126
verses.text: All the brethren who are with me salute you, at all times remembering you.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 8:127
verses.text: And I pray that ye may have health in the Lord, my beloved brethren, whom we love above all.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 8:128
verses.text: Here endeth the tenth Letter of holy Athanasius.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:1
verses.text: Letter XI.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:2
verses.text: —For.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:3
verses.text: Coss.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:4
verses.text: Constantius Augustus II, Constans I; Praefect, Philagrius the Cappadocian, for the second time; Indict.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:5
verses.text: xii; Easter-day xvii Kal.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:6
verses.text: Mai, xx Pharmuthi; aera Dioclet.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:7
verses.text: The blessed Paul, being girt about with every virtue, and called faithful of the Lord—for he was conscious of nothing in himself but what was a virtue and a praise, or what was in harmony with love and godliness—clave to these things more and more, and was carried up even to heavenly places, and was borne to Paradise; to the end that, as he surpassed the conversation of men, he should be exalted above men.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:8
verses.text: And when he descended, he preached to every man; 'We know in part, and we prophesy in part; here I know in part; but then shall I know even as also I am known.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:9
verses.text: ' For, in truth, he was known to those saints who are in heaven, as their fellow-citizen.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:10
verses.text: And in relation to all that is future and perfect, the things known by him here were in part; but with respect to those things which were committed and entrusted to him by the Lord, he was perfect; as he said, 'We who are perfect, should be thus minded.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:11
verses.text: ' For as the Gospel of Christ is the fulfilment and accomplishment of the ministration which was supplied by the law of Israel, so future things will be the accomplishment of such as now exist, the Gospel being then fulfilled, and the faithful receiving those things which, not seeing now, they yet hope for, as Paul saith; 'For what a man seeth, why doth he also hope for? But if we hope for those things we see [not], we then by patience wait for them.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:12
verses.text: ' Since then that blessed man was of such a character, and apostolic grace was committed to him, he wrote, wishing 'that all men should be as he was.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:13
verses.text: ' For virtue is philanthropic, and great is the company of the kingdom of heaven, for thousands of thousands and myriads of myriads there serve the Lord.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:14
verses.text: And though a man enters it through a strait and narrow way, yet having entered, he beholds immeasurable space, and a place greater than any other, as they declare, who were eye-witnesses and heirs of these things.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:15
verses.text: 'Thou didst place afflictions before us.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:16
verses.text: ' But afterwards, having related their afflictions, they say, 'Thou broughtest us forth into a wide place;' and again, 'In affliction Thou hast enlarged us.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:17
verses.text: ' For truly, my brethren, the course of the saints here is straitened; since they either toil painfully through longing for those things which are to come, as he who said, 'Woe is me that my pilgrimage is prolonged;' or they are distressed and spent for the salvation of other men, as Paul wrote to the Corinthians, saying, 'Lest, when I come to you, God should humble me, and I should bewail many of those who have sinned already, and not repented for the uncleanness and fornication and lasciviousness which they have committed.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:18
verses.text: ' As Samuel bewailed the destruction of Saul, and Jeremiah wept for the captivity of the people.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:19
verses.text: But after this affliction, and sorrow, and sighing, when they depart from this world, a certain divine gladness, and pleasure, and exultation receives them, from which misery and sorrow, and sighing, flee away.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:20
verses.text: Since we are thus circumstanced, my brethren, let us never loiter in the path of virtue; for hereto he counsels us, saying, 'Be ye followers of me, as I also am of Christ.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:21
verses.text: ' For he gave this advice not to the Corinthians only, since he was not their Apostle only, but being 'a teacher of the Gentiles in faith and verity,' he admonished us all through them; and in short, the things he wrote to each particular person are commandments common to all men.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:22
verses.text: On this account in writing to different people, some he exhorted as, for instance, in the Epistles to the Romans, and the Ephesians, and Philemon.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:23
verses.text: Some he reproved, and was indignant with them, as in the case of the Corinthians and Galatians.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:24
verses.text: To some he gave advice, as to the Colossians and Thessalonians.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:25
verses.text: The Philippians he approved of, and rejoiced in them.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:26
verses.text: The Hebrews he taught that the law was a shadow to them.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:27
verses.text: But to his elect sons, Timothy and Titus, when they were near, he gave instruction; when far away, he put them in remembrance.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:28
verses.text: For he was all things to all men; and being himself a perfect man, he adapted his teaching to the need of every one, so that by all means he might rescue some of them.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:29
verses.text: Therefore his word was not without fruit; but in every place it is planted and productive even to this day.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:30
verses.text: And wherefore, my beloved? For it is right that we should search into the apostolic mind.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:31
verses.text: Not only in the beginning of the Epistles, but towards their close, and in the middle of them, he used persuasions and admonitions.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:32
verses.text: I hope therefore that, by your prayers, I shall in no respect falsely represent the plan of that holy man.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:33
verses.text: As he was well skilled in these divine matters, and knew the power of the divine teaching, he deemed it necessary, in the first place, to make known the word concerning Christ, and the mystery regarding Him; and then afterwards to point to the correction of habits, so that when they had learned to know the Lord, they might earnestly desire to do those things which He commanded.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:34
verses.text: For when the Guide to the laws is unknown, one does not readily pass on to the observance of them.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:35
verses.text: Faithful Moses, the minister of God, adopted this method; for when he promulgated the words of the divine dispensation of laws, he first proclaimed the matters relating to the knowledge of God: 'Hear, O Israel, the Lord thy God is one Lord.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:36
verses.text: ' Afterwards, having shadowed Him forth to the people, and taught of Him in Whom they ought to believe, and informed their minds of Him Who is truly God, he proceeds to lay down the law relating to those things whereby a man may be well-pleasing to Him, saying, 'Thou shalt not commit adultery; thou shalt not steal;' together with the other commandments.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:37
verses.text: For also, according to the Apostolic teaching, 'He that draweth near to God must believe that He is, and that He is a rewarder of them that seek Him.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:38
verses.text: ' Now He is sought by means of virtuous deeds, as the prophet saith; 'Seek ye the Lord, and when ye have found Him, call upon Him; when He is near to you, let the wicked forsake his ways, and the lawless man his thoughts.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:40
verses.text: It will also be well if a man is not offended at the testimony of the Shepherd, saying in the beginning of his book, 'Before all things believe that there is one God, Who created and established all these things, and from non-existence called them into being.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:41
verses.text: ' And, further, the blessed Evangelists—who recorded the words of the Lord—in the beginning of the Gospels, wrote the things concerning our Saviour; so that, having first made known the Lord, the Creator, they might be believed when narrating the events that took place.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:42
verses.text: For how could they have been believed, when writing respecting him who [was blind] from his mother's womb, and those other blind men who recovered their sight, and those who rose from the dead, and the changing of water into wine, and those lepers who were cleansed; if they had not taught of Him as the Creator, writing, 'In the beginning was the Word?' Or, according to Matthew, that He Who was born of the seed of David, was Emmanuel, and the Son of the living God? He from Whom the Jews, with the Arians, turn away their faces, but Whom we acknowledge and worship.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:43
verses.text: The Apostle therefore, as was meet, sent to different people, but his own son he especially reminded, 'that he should not despise the things in which he had been instructed by him,' and enjoined on him, 'Remember Jesus Christ, who rose from the dead, of the seed of David, according to my Gospel.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:44
verses.text: ' And speaking of these things being delivered to him, to be always had in remembrance, he immediately writes to him, saying, 'Meditate on these things: be engaged in them.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:45
verses.text: ' For constant meditation, and the remembrance of divine words, strengthens piety towards God, and produces a love to Him inseparable and not merely formal; as he, being of this mind, speaks about himself and others like-minded, saying boldly, 'Who shall separate us from the love of God?' For such men, being confirmed in the Lord, and possessing an unshaken disposition towards Him, and being one in spirit (for 'he who is joined to the Spirit is one spirit'), are sure 'as the mount Sion;' and although ten thousand trials may rage against them, they are founded upon a rock, which is Christ.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:46
verses.text: In Him the careless take no delight; and having no continuous purpose of good, they are sullied by temporal attacks, and esteem nothing more highly than present things, being unstable and deserving reproof as regards the faith.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:47
verses.text: For 'either the care of this world, or the deceitfulness of riches, chokes them;' or, as Jesus said in that parable which had reference to them, since they have not established the faith that has been preached to them, but continue only for a time, immediately, in time of persecution, or when affliction ariseth through the word, they are offended.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:48
verses.text: Now those who meditate evil we say, [think] not truth, but falsehood and not righteousness, but iniquity, for their tongue learns to speak lies.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:49
verses.text: They have done evil, and have not ceased that they might repent.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:50
verses.text: For, persevering with delight in wicked actions, they hasten thereto without turning back, even treading under foot the commandment with regard to neighbours, and, instead of loving them, devise evil against them, as the saint testifies, saying, 'And those who seek me evil have spoken vanity, and imagined deceit all the day.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:51
verses.text: ' But that the cause of such meditation is none other than the want of instruction, the divine proverb has already declared; 'The son that forsaketh the commandment of his father meditateth evil words.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:52
verses.text: ' But such meditation, because it is evil, the Holy Spirit blames in these words, and reproves too in other terms, saying, 'Your hands are polluted with blood, your fingers with sins; your lips have spoken lawlessness, and your tongue imagineth iniquity: no man speaketh right things, nor is there true judgment.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:53
verses.text: ' But what the end is of such perverse imagining, He immediately declares, saying, 'They trust in vanities and speak falsehood; for they conceive mischief, and bring forth lawlessness.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:54
verses.text: They have hatched the eggs of an asp, and woven a spider's web; and he who is prepared to eat of their eggs, when he breaks them finds gall, and a basilisk therein.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:55
verses.text: ' Again, what the hope of such is, He has already announced.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:56
verses.text: 'Because righteousness does not overtake them, when they waited for light, they had darkness; when they waited for brightness, they walked in a thick cloud.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:57
verses.text: They shall grope for the wall like the blind, and as those who have no eyes shall they grope; they shall fall at noon-day as at midnight; when dead, they shall groan.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:58
verses.text: They shall roar together as a bear, or as a dove.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:59
verses.text: '  This is the fruit of wickedness, these rewards are given to its familiars, for perverseness does not deliver its own.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:60
verses.text: But in truth, against them it sets itself, and it tears them first, and on them especially it summons ruin.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:61
verses.text: Woe to them against whom these are brought; for 'it is sharper than a two-edged sword,' slaying beforehand and very swiftly those who will lay hold of it.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:62
verses.text: For their tongue, according to the testimony of the Psalmist, is a 'sharp sword, and their teeth spears and arrows.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:63
verses.text: ' But the wonderful part is that while often he against whom men imagine [harm] suffers nothing, they are pierced by their own spears: for they possess, even in themselves, before they reach others, anger, wrath, malice, guile, hatred, bitterness.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:64
verses.text: Although they may not be able to bring these upon others, they forthwith return upon and against themselves, as he prays, saying, 'Let their sword enter into their own heart.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:65
verses.text: ' There is also such a proverb as this: 'The wicked is held fast by the chain of his sins.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:67
verses.text: The Jews in their imaginings, and in their agreeing to act unjustly against the Lord, forgot that they were bringing wrath upon themselves.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:68
verses.text: Therefore does the Word lament for them, saying, 'Why do the people exalt themselves, and the nations imagine vain things?' For vain indeed was the imagination of the Jews, meditating death against the Life, and devising unreasonable things against the 'Word of the Father.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:69
verses.text: ' For who that looks upon their dispersion, and the desolation of their city, may not aptly say, 'Woe unto them, for they have imagined an evil imagination, saying against their own soul, let us bind the righteous man, because he is not pleasing to us.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:70
verses.text: ' And full well is it so, my brethren; for when they erred concerning the Scriptures, they knew not that 'he who diggeth a pit for his neighbour falleth therein; and he who destroyeth a hedge, a serpent shall bite him.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:71
verses.text: ' And if they had not turned their faces from the Lord, they would have feared what was written before in the divine Psalms: 'The heathen are caught in the pit which they made; in the snare which they hid is their own foot taken.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:72
verses.text: The Lord is known when executing judgments: by the works of his hands is the sinner taken.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:73
verses.text: ' Let them observe this, and how that 'the snare they know not shall come upon them, and the net they hid take them.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:74
verses.text: ' But they understood not these things, for had they done so, 'they would not have crucified the Lord of glory.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:76
verses.text: Therefore the righteous and faithful servants of the Lord, who 'are made disciples for the kingdom of heaven, and bring forth from it things new and old;' and who 'meditate on the words of the Lord, when sitting in the house, when lying down or rising up, and when walking by the way;'—since they are of good hope because of the promise of the Spirit which said, 'Blessed is the man that hath not walked in the counsel of the ungodly, nor stood in the way of sinners, nor sat in the seat of corrupters; but his delight is in the law of the Lord, and in His law doth he meditate day and night;'—being grounded in faith, rejoicing in hope, fervent in spirit, they have boldness to say, 'My mouth shall speak wisdom, and the meditation of my heart shall be of understanding.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:77
verses.text: ' And again, 'I have meditated on all Thy works, and on the work of Thy hands has been my meditation.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:78
verses.text: ' And, 'If I have remembered Thee on my bed, and in the morning have meditated on Thee.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:79
verses.text: ' Afterwards, advancing in boldness, they say, 'The meditation of my heart is before Thee at all times.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:80
verses.text: ' And what is the end of such an one? He cites immediately; 'The Lord is my Helper and my Redeemer.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:81
verses.text: ' For to those who thus examine themselves, and conform their hearts to the Lord, nothing adverse shall happen; for indeed, their heart is strengthened by confidence in the Lord, as it is written, 'They who trust in the Lord are as mount Sion: he who dwelleth in Jerusalem shall not be moved for ever.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:82
verses.text: ' For if at any time, the crafty one shall be presumptuously bold against them, chiefly that he may break the rank of the saints, and cause a division among brethren; even in this the Lord is with them, not only as an avenger on their behalf, but also when they have already been beaten, as a deliverer for them.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:83
verses.text: For this is the divine promise; 'The Lord shall fight for you.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:84
verses.text: ' Henceforth, although afflictions and trials from without overtake them, yet, being fashioned after the apostolic words, and 'being stedfast in tribulations, and persevering in prayers' and in meditation on the law, they stand against those things which befall them, are well-pleasing to God, and give utterance to the words which are written, 'Afflictions and distresses are come upon me; but Thy commandments are my meditation.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:86
verses.text: And whereas, not only in action, but also in the thoughts of the mind, men are moved to deeds of virtue, he afterwards adds, saying, 'Mine eyes prevent the dawn, that I might meditate on Thy words.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:87
verses.text: ' For it is meet that the spiritual meditations of those who are whole should precede their bodily actions.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:88
verses.text: And does not our Saviour, when intending to teach this very thing begin with the thoughts of the mind? saying, 'Whosoever looketh on a woman to lust after her, hath already committed adultery:' and, 'Whosoever shall be angry with his brother, is guilty of murder.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:89
verses.text: ' For where there is no wrath, murder is prevented; and where lust is first removed, there can be no accusation of adultery.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:90
verses.text: Hence meditation on the law is necessary, my beloved, and uninterrupted converse with virtue, 'that the saint may lack nothing, but be perfect to every good work.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:91
verses.text: ' For by these things is the promise of eternal life, as Paul wrote to Timothy, calling constant meditation exercise, and saying, 'Exercise thyself unto godliness; for bodily exercise profiteth little; but godliness is profitable for all things, since it has the promise of the present life, and of that which is eternal.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:93
verses.text: Worthy of admiration is the virtue of that man, my brethren! for through Timothy he enjoins upon all, that they should have regard to nothing more than to godliness, but above everything to adjudge the chief place to faith in God.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:94
verses.text: For what grace has the unrighteous man, though he may feign to keep the commandments? Nay rather, the unrighteous man is unable even to keep a portion of the law, for as is his mind, such of necessity must be his actions; as the Spirit says, reproving such; 'The fool hath said in his heart, there is no God.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:95
verses.text: ' After this the Word, shewing that actions correspond with thoughts, says, 'They are corrupt; they are profane in their machinations.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:96
verses.text: ' The unrighteous man then, in every respect corrupts his body; stealing, committing adultery, cursing, being drunken, and doing such like things.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:97
verses.text: Even as Jeremiah, the prophet, convicts Israel of these things, crying out and saying, 'Oh, that I had a lodge far off in the wilderness! then would I leave my people and depart from them: for they are all adulterers, an assembly of oppressors, who draw out their tongue as a bow; lying and not truth has prevailed upon the earth, and they proceed from iniquities to iniquities; but Me they have not known.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:98
verses.text: ' Thus, for wickedness and falsehood, and for deeds, in which they [proceed] from iniquity to iniquity, he reproves their practices; but, because they knew not the Lord, and were faithless, he charges them with unrighteousness.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:99
verses.text: For faith and godliness are allied to each other, and sisters; and he who believes in Him is godly, and he also who is godly, believes the more.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:100
verses.text: He therefore who is in a state of wickedness, undoubtedly also wanders from the faith; and he who falls from godliness, falls from the true faith.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:101
verses.text: Paul, for instance, bearing testimony to the same point, advises his disciple, saying, 'Avoid profane conversations; for they increase unto more ungodliness, and their word takes hold as doth a canker, of whom are Hymenaeus and Philetus.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:102
verses.text: ' In what their wickedness consisted he declares, saying, 'Who have erred from the faith, saying that the resurrection is already past.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:103
verses.text: ' But again, desirous of shewing that faith is yoked with godliness, the Apostle says, 'And all those who will live godly in Jesus Christ shall suffer persecution.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:104
verses.text: ' Afterwards, that no man should renounce godliness through persecution, he counsels them to preserve the faith, adding, 'Thou, therefore, continue in the things thou hast learned, and hast been assured of.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:105
verses.text: ' And as when brother is helped by brother, they become as a wall to each other; so faith and godliness, being of like growth, hang together, and he who is practised in the one, of necessity is strengthened by the other.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:106
verses.text: Therefore, wishing the disciple to be exercised in godliness unto the end, and to contend for the faith, he counsels them, saying, 'Fight the good fight of faith, and lay hold on eternal life.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:107
verses.text: ' For if a man first put away the wickedness of idols, and rightly confesses Him Who is truly God, he next fights by faith with those who war against Him.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:108
verses.text: For of these two things we speak of—faith and godliness—the hope is the same, even everlasting life; for he saith, 'Fight the good fight of faith; lay hold on eternal life.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:109
verses.text: ' And, 'exercise thyself unto godliness, for it hath the promise of the life that now is, and of that which is to come.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:110
verses.text: ' For this cause, the Ario-maniacs, who now have gone out from the Church, being opponents of Christ, have digged a pit of unbelief, into which they themselves have been thrust; and, since they have advanced in ungodliness, they 'overthrow the faith of the simple;' blaspheming the Son of God, and saying that He is a creature, and has His being from things which are not.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:111
verses.text: But as then against the adherents of Philetus and Hymenaeus, so now the Apostle forewarns all men against ungodliness like theirs, saying, 'The foundation of God standeth sure, having this seal, The Lord knoweth them that are His; and, Let every one that nameth the name of the Lord depart from iniquity.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:112
verses.text: ' For it is well that a man should depart from wickedness and deeds of iniquity, that he may be able properly to celebrate the feast; for he who is defiled with the pollutions of the wicked is not able to sacrifice the Passover to the Lord our God.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:113
verses.text: Hence, the people who were then in Egypt said, 'We cannot sacrifice the Passover in Egypt to the Lord our God.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:114
verses.text: ' For God, Who is over all, willed that they should go far away from the servants of Pharaoh, and from the furnace of iron; so that being set free from wickedness, and having carefully put away from them all strange notions, they might receive the knowledge of God and of virtuous actions.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:115
verses.text: For He saith, 'Go far from them: depart from the midst of them, and touch not the unclean things.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:116
verses.text: ' For a man will not otherwise depart from sin, and lay hold on virtuous deeds, than by meditation on his acts; and when he has been practised by exercise in godliness, he will lay hold on the confession of faith, which also Paul, after he had fought the fight, possessed, namely, the crown of righteousness which was laid up; which the righteous Judge will give, not to him alone, but to all who are like him.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:117
verses.text: For such meditation and exercise in godliness, being at all times the habit of the saints, is urgent on us at the present time, when the divine word desires us to keep the feast with them if we are in this disposition.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:118
verses.text: For what else is the feast, but the constant worship of God, and the recognition of godliness, and unceasing prayers from the whole heart with agreement? So Paul wishing us to be ever in this disposition, commands, saying, 'Rejoice evermore; pray without ceasing; in everything give thanks.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:119
verses.text: ' Not therefore separately, but unitedly and collectively, let us all keep the feast together, as the prophet exhorts, saying, 'O come, let us rejoice in the Lord; let us make a joyful noise unto God our Saviour.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:120
verses.text: ' Who then is so negligent, or who so disobedient to the divine voice, as not to leave everything, and run to the general and common assembly of the feast? which is not in one place only, for not one place alone keeps the feast; but 'into all the earth their song has gone forth, and to the ends of the world their words.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:121
verses.text: ' And the sacrifice is not offered in one place, but 'in every nation, incense and a pure sacrifice is offered unto God.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:122
verses.text: ' So when in like manner from all in every place, praise and prayer shall ascend to the gracious and good Father, when the whole Catholic Church which is in every place, with gladness and rejoicing, celebrates together the same worship to God, when all men in common send up a song of praise and say, Amen; how blessed will it not be, my brethren! who will not, at that time, be engaged, praying rightly? For the walls of every adverse power, yea even of Jericho especially, falling down, and the gift of the Holy Spirit being then richly poured upon all men, every man perceiving the coming of the Spirit shall say, 'We are all filled in the morning with Thy favour, and we rejoice and are made glad in our days.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:124
verses.text: Since this is so, let us make a joyful noise with the saints, and let no one of us fail of his duty in these things; counting as nothing the affliction or the trials which, especially at this time, have been enviously directed against us by the party of Eusebius.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:125
verses.text: Even now they wish to injure us, and by their accusations to compass our death, because of that godliness, whose helper is the Lord.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:126
verses.text: But, as faithful servants of God, knowing that He is our salvation in the time of trouble:—for our Lord promised beforehand, saying, 'Blessed are ye when men revile you and persecute you, and say all manner of evil against you falsely, for My sake.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:127
verses.text: Rejoice, and be exceeding glad, for your reward is great in heaven.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:128
verses.text: ' Again, it is the Redeemer's own word, that affliction shall not befall every man in this world, but only those who have a holy fear of Him:—on this account, the more the enemies hem us in, the more let us be at liberty; although they revile us, let us come together; and the more they would turn us aside from godliness, let us the more boldly preach it saying, 'All these things are come upon us, yet have we not forgotten Thee,' and we have not done evil with the Ario-maniacs, who say that Thou hast existence from those things that exist not.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:129
verses.text: The Word which is eternally with the Father, is also from Him.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:130
verses.text: Let us therefore keep the feast, my brethren, celebrating it not at all as an occasion of distress and mourning, neither let us mingle with heretics through temporal trials brought upon us by godliness.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:131
verses.text: But if anything that would promote joy and gladness should offer, let us attend to it; so that our heart may not be sad, like that of Cain; but that, like faithful and good servants of the Lord, we may hear the words, 'Enter into the joy of thy Lord.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:132
verses.text: ' For we do not institute days of mourning and sorrow, as some may consider these of Easter to be, but we keep the feast, being filled with joy and gladness.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:133
verses.text: We keep it then, not regarding it after the deceitful error of the Jews, nor according to the teaching of the Arians, which takes away the Son from the Godhead, and numbers Him among creatures; but we look to the correct doctrine we derive from the Lord.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:134
verses.text: For the guile of the Jews, and the unbounded impiety of the Arians, cause nothing but sad reflections, for the former at the beginning slew the Lord; but these latter take away His position of having conquered that death to which the Jews brought Him, in that they say He is not the Creator, but a creature.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:135
verses.text: For if He were a creature, He would have been holden by death; but if He was not holden by death, according to the Scriptures, He is not a creature, but the Lord of the creatures, and the subject of this immortal feast.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:136
verses.text: For the Lord of death would abolish death, and being Lord, what He would was accomplished; for we have all passed from death unto life.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:137
verses.text: But the imagination of the Jews, and of those who are like them, was vain, since the result was not such as they contemplated, but turned out adverse to themselves; and 'at both of them He that sitteth in the heaven shall laugh: the Lord shall have them in derision.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:138
verses.text: ' Hence, when our Saviour was led to death, He restrained the women who followed Him weeping, saying, 'Weep not for Me;' meaning to shew that the Lord's death is an event, not of sorrow but of joy, and that He Who dies for us is alive.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:139
verses.text: For He does not derive His being from those things which are not, but from the Father.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:140
verses.text: It is truly a subject of joy, that we can see the signs of victory against death, even our own incorruptibility, through the body of the Lord.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:141
verses.text: For since He rose gloriously, it is clear that the resurrection of all of us will take place; and since His body remained without corruption, there can be no doubt regarding our incorruption.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:142
verses.text: For as by one man, as saith Paul (and it is the truth), sin passed upon all men, so by the resurrection of our Lord Jesus Christ, we shall all rise.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:143
verses.text: 'For,' he says, 'this corruptible must put on incorruption, and this mortal must put on immortality.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:144
verses.text: ' Now this came to pass in the time of the Passion, in which our Lord died for us, for 'our Passover, Christ, is sacrificed.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:145
verses.text: ' Therefore, because He was sacrificed, let each of us feed upon Him, and with alacrity and diligence partake of His sustenance; since He is given to all without grudging, and is in every one 'a well of water flowing to everlasting life.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:147
verses.text: We begin the fast of forty days on the ninth of the month Phamenoth (Mar.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:148
verses.text: ); and having, in these days, served the Lord with abstinence, and first purified ourselves, we commence also the holy Easter on the fourteenth of the month Pharmuthi (April ).

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:149
verses.text: Afterwards, extending the fast to the seventh day, on the seventeenth of the month, let us rest late in the evening.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:150
verses.text: And the light of the Lord having first dawned upon us, and the holy Sunday on which our Lord rose shining upon us, we should rejoice and be glad with the joy which arises from good works, during the seven weeks which remain—to Pentecost—giving glory to the Father, and saying, 'This is the day which the Lord hath made: we will rejoice and be glad in it,' through our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ, through Whom to the same, and to His Father, be glory and dominion for ever and ever, Amen.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:151
verses.text: Salute one another with a holy kiss.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:152
verses.text: All the brethren who are with me salute you.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:153
verses.text: That ye may have health in the Lord, I pray, brethren beloved.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 9:154
verses.text: Here endeth the eleventh Letter of holy Athanasius.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:1
verses.text: XII.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:2
verses.text: —(Probably for  a.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:3
verses.text: d.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:4
verses.text: ) To the Beloved Brother, and our fellow Minister Serapion.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:5
verses.text: Thanks be to Divine Providence for those things which, at all times, it vouchsafes to us; for it has vouchsafed to us now to come to the season of the festival.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:6
verses.text: Having, therefore, according to custom, written the Letter respecting the festival, I have sent it to you, my beloved; that through you all the brethren may be able to know the day of rejoicing.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:7
verses.text: But because some Meletians, being come from Syria, have boasted that they had received what does not belong to them, I mean, that they also were reckoned in the Catholic Church; on this account, I have sent to you a copy of one letter of our fellow-ministers who are of Palestine, that when it reaches you, you may know the fraud of the pretenders in this matter.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:8
verses.text: For because they boasted, as I have said before, it was necessary for me to write to the Bishops who are in Syria, and immediately those of Palestine sent us a reply, having agreed in the judgment against them, as you may learn from this example.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:9
verses.text: That you may not have to consider the letters of all the Bishops one after the other, I have sent you one, which is of like character with the rest, in order that from it you may know the purport of all of them.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:10
verses.text: I know also that when they are convicted in this matter, they will incur perfect odium at the hands of all men.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:11
verses.text: And thus far concerning the pretenders.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:12
verses.text: But I have further deemed it highly necessary and very urgent, to make known to your modesty—for I have written this to each one—that you should proclaim the fast of forty days to the brethren, and persuade them to fast, lest, while all the world is fasting, we who are in Egypt should be derided, as the only people who do not fast, but take our pleasure in these days.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:13
verses.text: For if, on account of the Letter [not] being yet read, we do not fast, we should take away this pretext, and it should be read before the fast of forty days, so that they may not make this an excuse for neglect or fasting.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:14
verses.text: Also, when it is read, they may be able to learn about the fast.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:15
verses.text: But O, my beloved, whether in this way or any other, persuade and teach them to fast the forty days.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:16
verses.text: For it is a disgrace that when all the world does this, those alone who are in Egypt, instead of fasting, should find their pleasure.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:17
verses.text: For even I being grieved because men deride us for this, have been constrained to write to you.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:18
verses.text: When therefore you receive the letters, and have read them and given the exhortation, write to me in return, my beloved, that I also may rejoice upon learning it.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:19
verses.text: But I have also thought it necessary to inform you of the fact, that Bishops have succeeded those who have fallen asleep.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:20
verses.text: In Tanis in the stead of Elias, is Theodorus.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:21
verses.text: In Arsenoitis, Silvanus instead of Calosiris.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:22
verses.text: In Paralus, Nemesion is instead of Nonnus.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:23
verses.text: In Bucolia is Heraclius.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:24
verses.text: In Tentyra, Andronicus is instead of Saprion, his father.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:25
verses.text: In Thebes, Philon instead of Philon.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:26
verses.text: In Maximianopolis, Herminus instead of Atras.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:27
verses.text: In the lower Apollon is Sarapion instead of Plution.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:28
verses.text: In Aphroditon, Serenus is in the place of Theodorus.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:29
verses.text: In Rhinocoruron, Salomon.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:30
verses.text: In Stathma, Arabion, and in Marmarica.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:31
verses.text: In the eastern Garyathis, Andragathius in the place of Hierax.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:32
verses.text: In the southern Garyathis, Quintus instead of Nicon.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:33
verses.text: So that to these you may write, and from these receive the canonical Letters.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:34
verses.text: Salute one another with a holy kiss.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:35
verses.text: All the brethren who are with me salute you.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:36
verses.text: He wrote this from Rome.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 11:37
verses.text: There is no twelfth Letter.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:1
verses.text: Letter XIII.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:2
verses.text: —(For.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:3
verses.text: ) Coss.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:4
verses.text: Marcellinus, Probinus; Praef.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:5
verses.text: Longinus; Indict.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:6
verses.text: xiv; Easter-day, xiii Kal.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:7
verses.text: Maii, xxiv Pharmuthi; aera Dioclet.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:8
verses.text: Again, my beloved brethren, I am ready to notify to you the saving feast, which will take place according to annual custom.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:9
verses.text: For although the opponents of Christ have oppressed you together with us with afflictions and sorrows; yet, God having comforted us by our mutual faith, behold, I write to you even from Rome.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:10
verses.text: Keeping the feast here with the brethren, still I keep it with you also in will and in spirit, for we send up prayers in common to God, 'Who hath granted us not only to believe in Him, but also now to suffer for His sake.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:11
verses.text: ' For troubled as we are, because we are so far from you, He moves us to write, that by a letter we might comfort ourselves, and provoke one another to good.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:12
verses.text: For, indeed, numerous afflictions and bitter persecutions directed against the Church have been against us.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:13
verses.text: For heretics, corrupt in their mind, untried in the faith, rising against the truth, violently persecute the Church, and of the brethren, some are scourged and others torn with stripes, and hardest of all, their insults reach even to the Bishops.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:14
verses.text: Nevertheless, it is not becoming, on this account, that we should neglect the feast.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:15
verses.text: But we should especially remember it, and not at all forget its commemoration from time to time.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:16
verses.text: Now the unbelievers do not consider that there is a season for feasts, because they spend all their lives in revelling and follies; and the feasts which they keep are an occasion of grief rather than of joy.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:17
verses.text: But to us in this present life they are above all an uninterrupted passage [to heaven]—it is indeed our season.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:18
verses.text: For such things as these serve for exercise and trial, so that, having approved ourselves zealous and chosen servants of Christ, we may be fellow-heirs with the saints.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:19
verses.text: For thus Job: 'The whole world is a place of trial to men upon the earth.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:20
verses.text: ' Nevertheless, they are proved in this world by afflictions, labours, and sorrows, to the end that each one may receive of God such reward as is meet for him, as He saith by the prophet, 'I am the Lord, Who trieth the hearts, and searcheth the reins, to give to every one according to his ways.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:22
verses.text: Not that He first knows the things of a man on his being proved (for He knows them all before they come to pass), but because He is good and philanthropic, He distributes to each a due reward according to his actions, so that every man may exclaim, Righteous is the judgment of God! As the prophet says again, 'The Lord trieth the just, and discerneth the reins.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:23
verses.text: ' Again, for this cause He tries each one of us, either that to those who know it not, virtue may be manifested by means of those who are proved, as was said respecting Job; 'Thinkest thou that I was revealed to thee for any other cause, than that thou shouldest be seen righteous?' or that, when men come to a sense of their deeds, they may be able to know of what manner they are, and so may either repent of their wickedness, or abide confirmed in the faith.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:24
verses.text: Now the blessed Paul, when troubled by afflictions, and persecutions, and hunger and thirst, 'in everything was a conqueror, through Jesus Christ, Who loved us.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:25
verses.text: ' Through suffering he was weak indeed in body, yet, believing and hoping, he was made strong in spirit, and his strength was made perfect in weakness.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:26
verses.text: The other saints also, who had a like confidence in God, accepted a like probation with gladness, as Job said, 'Blessed be the name of the Lord.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:27
verses.text: ' But the Psalmist, 'Search me, O Lord, and try me: prove my reins and my heart.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:28
verses.text: ' For since, when the strength is proved, it convinceth the foolish, they perceiving the cleansing and the advantage resulting from the divine fire, were not discouraged in trials like these, but they rather delighted in them, suffering no injury at all from the things which happened, but being seen to shine more brightly, like gold from the fire, as he said, who was tried in such a school of discipline as this; 'Thou hast tried my heart, Thou hast visited me in the night-season; Thou hast proved me, and hast not found iniquity in me, so that my mouth shall not speak of the works of men.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:29
verses.text: ' But those whose actions are not restrained by law, who know of nothing beyond eating and drinking and dying, account trials as danger.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:30
verses.text: They soon stumble at them, so that, being untried in the faith, they are given over to a reprobate mind, and do those things which are not seemly.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:31
verses.text: Therefore the blessed Paul, when urging us to such exercises as these, and having before measured himself by them, says, 'Therefore I take pleasure in afflictions, in infirmities.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:32
verses.text: ' And again, 'Exercise thyself unto godliness.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:33
verses.text: ' For since he knew the persecutions that befel those who chose to live in godliness, he wished his disciples to meditate beforehand on the difficulties connected with godliness; that when trials should come, and affliction arise, they might be able to bear them easily, as having been exercised in these things.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:34
verses.text: For in those things wherewith a man has been conversant in mind, he ordinarily experiences a hidden joy.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:35
verses.text: In this way, the blessed martyrs, becoming at first conversant with difficulties, were quickly perfected in Christ, regarding as nought the injury of the body, while they contemplated the expected rest.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:36
verses.text: But all those who 'call their lands by their own names,' and have wood, and hay, and stubble in their thoughts; such as these, since they are strangers to difficulties, become aliens from the kingdom of heaven.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:37
verses.text: Had they however known that 'tribulation perfecteth patience, and patience experience, and experience hope, and hope maketh not ashamed,' they would have exercised themselves, after the example of Paul, who said, 'I keep under my body and bring it into subjection, lest when I have preached to others, I myself should be a castaway.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:38
verses.text: ' They would easily have borne the afflictions which were brought upon them to prove them from time to time, if the prophetic admonition had been listened to by them; 'It is good for a man to take up Thy yoke in his youth; he shall sit alone and shall be silent, because he hath taken Thy yoke upon him.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:39
verses.text: He will give his cheek to him who smiteth him; he will be filled with reproaches.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:40
verses.text: Because the Lord does not cast away for ever; for when He abases, He is gracious, according to the multitude of His tender mercies.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:41
verses.text: ' For though all these things should proceed from the enemies, stripes, insults, reproaches, yet shall they avail nothing against the multitude of God's tender mercies; for we shall quickly recover from them since they are merely temporal, but God is always gracious, pouring out His tender mercies on those who please [Him].

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:42
verses.text: Therefore, my beloved brethren, we should not look at these temporal things, but fix our attention on those which are eternal.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:43
verses.text: Though affliction may come, it will have an end, though insult and persecution, yet are they nothing to the hope which is set [before us].

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:44
verses.text: For all present matters are trifling compared with those which are future; the sufferings of this present time not being worthy to be compared with the hope that is to come.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:45
verses.text: For what can be compared with the kingdom? or what is there in comparison with life eternal? Or what is all we could give here, to that which we shall inherit yonder? For we are 'heirs of God, and joint-heirs with Christ.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:46
verses.text: ' Therefore it is not right, my beloved, to consider afflictions and persecutions, but the hopes which are laid up for us because of persecutions.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:47
verses.text: Now to this the example of Issachar, the patriarch, may persuade, as the Scripture saith, 'Issachar desires that which is good, resting between the heritages; and when he saw that the rest was good, and the land fertile, he bowed his shoulder to labour, and became a husbandman.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:48
verses.text: ' Being consumed by divine love, like the spouse in the Canticles, he gathered abundance from the holy Scriptures, for his mind was captivated not by the old alone, but by both the heritages.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:49
verses.text: And hence as it were, spreading his wings, he beheld afar off 'the rest' which is in heaven, and,—since this 'land' consists of such beautiful works,—how much more truly the heavenly [country] must also [consist] of such; for the other is ever new, and grows not old.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:50
verses.text: For this 'land' passes away, as the Lord said; but that which is ready to receive the saints is immortal.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:51
verses.text: Now when Issachar, the patriarch, saw these things, he joyfully made his boast of afflictions and toils, bowing his shoulders that he might labour.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:52
verses.text: And he did not contend with those who smote him, neither was he disturbed by insults; but like a strong man triumphing the more by these things, and the more earnestly tilling his land, he received profit from it.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:53
verses.text: The Word scattered the seed, but he watchfully cultivated it, so that it brought forth fruit, even a hundred-fold.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:54
verses.text: Now what does this mean, my beloved, but that we also, when the enemies are arrayed against us, should glory in afflictions, and that when we are persecuted, we should not be discouraged, but should the rather press after the crown of the high calling in Christ Jesus our Lord? and that being insulted, we should not be disturbed, but should give our cheek to the smiter, and bow the shoulder? For the lovers of pleasure and the lovers of enmity are tried, as saith the blessed Apostle James, 'when they are drawn away by their own lusts and enticed.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:55
verses.text: ' But let us, knowing that we suffer for the truth, and that those who deny the Lord smite and persecute us, 'count it all joy, my brethren,' according to the words of James, 'when we fall into trials of various temptations, knowing that the trial of our faith worketh patience.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:56
verses.text: ' Let us rejoice as we keep the feast, my brethren, knowing that our salvation is ordered in the time of affliction.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:57
verses.text: For our Saviour did not redeem us by inactivity, but by suffering for us He abolished death.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:58
verses.text: And respecting this, He intimidated to us before, saying, 'In the world ye shall have tribulation.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:59
verses.text: ' But He did not say this to every man, but to those who diligently and faithfully perform good service to Him, knowing beforehand, that they should be persecuted who would live godly toward Him.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:60
verses.text: 'But evil-doers and sorcerers will wax worse and worse, deceiving and being deceived.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:61
verses.text: ' If therefore, like those expounders of dreams and false prophets who professed to give signs, these ignorant men being drunk, not with wine, but with their own wickedness, make a profession of priesthood, and glory in their threats, believe them not; but since we are tried, let us humble ourselves, not being drawn away by them.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:62
verses.text: For so God warned His people by Moses, saying, 'If there shall rise up among you a prophet, or a dreamer of dreams, and shall give signs and tokens, and the sign or the token shall come to pass which he spake to thee, saying, Let us go and serve strange gods, which ye have not known; ye shall not hearken unto the words of that prophet or that dreamer of dreams.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:63
verses.text: For the Lord your God trieth you, that He may know whether you will love the Lord your God with all your heart.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:64
verses.text: ' So we, when we are tried by these things, will not separate ourselves from the love of God.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:65
verses.text: But let us now keep the feast, my beloved, not as introducing a day of suffering, but of joy in Christ, by Whom we are fed every day.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:66
verses.text: Let us be mindful of Him Who was sacrificed in the days of the Passover; for we celebrate this, because Christ the Passover was sacrificed.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:67
verses.text: He Who once brought His people out of Egypt, and hath now abolished death, and him that had the power of death, that is the devil, will likewise now turn him to shame, and again grant aid to those who are troubled, and cry unto God day and night.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:68
verses.text: We begin the fast of forty days on the thirteenth of Phamenoth ( Mar.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:69
verses.text: ), and the holy week of Easter on the eighteenth of Pharmuthi (Apr.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:70
verses.text: ); and resting on the seventh day, being the twenty-third (Apr.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:71
verses.text: ), and the first of the great week having dawned on the twenty-fourth of the same month Pharmuthi (Apr.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:72
verses.text: ), let us reckon from it till Pentecost.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:73
verses.text: And at all times let us sing praises, calling on Christ, being delivered from our enemies by Christ Jesus our Lord, through Whom to the Father be glory and dominion for ever and ever, Amen.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:74
verses.text: Greet one another with a holy kiss.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:75
verses.text: All those who are here with me salute you.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:76
verses.text: I pray, my beloved brethren, that ye may have health in the Lord.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:77
verses.text: He wrote this also from Rome.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 12:78
verses.text: Here endeth the thirteenth Letter.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:1
verses.text: Letter XIV.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:2
verses.text: —(For.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:3
verses.text: ) Coss.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:4
verses.text: Augustus Constantius III, Constans II, Praef.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:5
verses.text: the same Longinus; Indict.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:6
verses.text: xv; Easter-day iii Id.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:7
verses.text: Apr.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:8
verses.text: , xvi Pharmuthi; aera Dioclet.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:9
verses.text: The gladness of our feast, my brethren, is always near at hand, and never fails those who wish to celebrate it.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:10
verses.text: For the Word is near, Who is all things on our behalf, even our Lord Jesus Christ, Who, having promised that His habitation with us should be perpetual, in virtue thereof cried, saying, 'Lo, I am with you all the days of the world.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:11
verses.text: ' For as He is the Shepherd, and the High Priest, and the Way and the Door, and everything at once to us, so again, He is shewn to us as the Feast, and the Holy day, according to the blessed Apostle; 'Our Passover, Christ, is sacrificed.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:12
verses.text: ' He it was who was expected, He caused a light to shine at the prayer of the Psalmist, who said, 'My Joy, deliver me from those who surround me;' this being indeed true rejoicing, this being a true feast, even deliverance from wickedness, whereto a man attains by thoroughly adopting an upright conversation, and being approved in his mind of godly submission towards God.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:13
verses.text: For thus the saints all their lives long were like men rejoicing at a feast.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:14
verses.text: One found rest in prayer to God, as blessed David, who rose in the night, not once but seven times.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:15
verses.text: Another gave glory in songs of praise, as great Moses, who sang a song of praise for the victory over Pharaoh, and those task-masters.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:16
verses.text: Others performed worship with unceasing diligence, like great Samuel and blessed Elijah; who have ceased from their course, and now keep the feast in heaven, and rejoice in what they formerly learnt through shadows, and from the types recognise the truth.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:17
verses.text: But what sprinklings shall we now employ, while we celebrate the feast? Who will be our guide, as we haste to this festival? None can do this, my beloved, but Him Whom you will name with me, even our Lord Jesus Christ Who said, 'I am the Way.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:18
verses.text: ' For it is He Who, according to the blessed John, 'taketh away the sin of the world.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:19
verses.text: ' He purifies our souls, as Jeremiah the prophet says in a certain place, 'Stand in the ways and see, and enquire, and look which is the good path, and ye shall find in it cleansing for your souls.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:20
verses.text: ' Of old time, the blood of he-goats and the ashes of a heifer, sprinkled upon those who were unclean, were fit only to purify the flesh; but now, through the grace of God the Word, every man is thoroughly cleansed.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:21
verses.text: Following Him, we may, even here, as on the threshold of the Jerusalem which is above, meditate beforehand on the feast which is eternal, as also the blessed Apostles, together following the Saviour Who was their Leader, have now become teachers of a like grace, saying, 'Behold, we have left all, and followed Thee.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:22
verses.text: ' For the following of the Lord, and the feast which is of the Lord, is not accomplished by words only, but by deeds, every enactment of laws and every command involving a distinct performance.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:23
verses.text: For as great Moses, when administering the holy laws, exacted a promise from the people, respecting the practice of them, so that having promised, they might not neglect them, and be accused as liars, thus also, the celebration of the least of the Passover raises no question, and demands no reply; but when the word is given, the performance of it follows, for He saith, 'And the children of Israel shall keep the Passover;' intending that there should be a ready performance of the commandment, while the command should aid its execution.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:24
verses.text: But respecting these matters, I have confidence in your wisdom, and your care for instruction.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:25
verses.text: Such points as these have been touched upon by us often and in various Letters.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:26
verses.text: But now, which is above all things most necessary, I wish to remind you, and myself with you, how that the command would have us come to the Paschal feast not profanely and without preparation, but with sacramental and doctrinal rites, and prescribed observances, as indeed we learn from the historical account, 'A man who is of another nation, or bought with money, or uncircumcised, shall not eat the Passover.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:27
verses.text: ' Neither should it be eaten in 'any' house, but He commands it to be done in haste; inasmuch as before we groaned and were made sad by the bondage to Pharaoh, and the commands of the task-masters.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:28
verses.text: For when in former time the children of Israel acted in this way, they were counted worthy to receive the type, which existed for the sake of this feast, nor is the feast now introduced on account of the type.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:29
verses.text: As also the Word of God, when desirous of this, said to His disciples, 'With desire I have desired to eat this Passover with you.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:30
verses.text: ' Now that is a wonderful account, for a man might have seen them at that time girded as for a procession or a dance, and going out with staves, and sandals, and unleavened bread.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:31
verses.text: These things, which took place before in shadows, were typical.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:32
verses.text: But now the Truth is nigh unto us, 'the Image of the invisible God,' our Lord Jesus Christ, the true Light, Who instead of a staff, is our sceptre, instead of unleavened bread, is the bread which came down from heaven, Who, instead of sandals, hath furnished us with the preparation of the Gospel, and Who, to speak briefly, by all these hath guided us to His Father.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:33
verses.text: And if enemies afflict us and persecute us, He again, instead of Moses, will encourage us with better words, saying, 'Be of good cheer; I have overcome the wicked one.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:34
verses.text: ' And if after we have passed over the Red Sea heat should again vex us or some bitterness of the waters befall us, even thence again the Lord will appear to us, imparting to us of His sweetness, and His life-giving fountain, saying, 'If any man thirst, let him come to Me, and drink.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:36
verses.text: Why therefore do we tarry, and why do we delay, and not come with all eagerness and diligence to the feast, trusting that it is Jesus who calleth us? Who is all things for us, and was laden in ten thousand ways for our salvation; Who hungered and thirsted for us, though He gives us food and drink in His saving gifts.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:37
verses.text: For this is His glory, this the miracle of His divinity, that He changed our sufferings for His happiness.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:38
verses.text: For, being life, He died that He might make us alive, being the Word, He became flesh, that He might instruct the flesh in the Word, and being the fountain of life, He thirsted our thirst, that thereby He might urge us to the feast, saying, 'If any man thirst, let him come to Me, and drink.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:39
verses.text: ' At that time, Moses proclaimed the beginning of the feast, saying, 'This month is the beginning of months to you.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:40
verses.text: ' But the Lord, Who came down in the end of the ages, proclaimed a different day, not as though He would abolish the law, far from it, but that He should establish the law, and be the end of the law.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:41
verses.text: 'For Christ is the end of the law to every one that believeth in righteousness;' as the blessed Paul saith, 'Do we make void the law by faith? far from it: we rather establish the law.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:42
verses.text: ' Now these things astonished even the officers who were sent by the Jews, so that wondering they said to the Pharisees, 'No man ever thus spake.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:43
verses.text: ' What was it then that astonished those officers, or what was it which so affected the men as to make them marvel? It was nothing but the boldness and authority of our Saviour.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:44
verses.text: For when of old time prophets and scribes studied the Scriptures, they perceived that what they read did not refer to themselves, but to others.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:45
verses.text: Moses, for instance, 'A prophet will the Lord raise up unto you of your brethren, like unto me; to him hearken in all that he commands you.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:46
verses.text: ' Isaiah again, 'Behold, a virgin shall conceive and bear a son, and ye shall call his name Emmanuel.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:47
verses.text: ' And others prophesied in different and various ways, concerning the Lord.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:48
verses.text: But by the Lord, of Himself, and of no other, were these things prophesied; to Himself He limited them all, saying, 'If any man thirst, let him come to Me'—not to any other person, but to 'Me.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:49
verses.text: ' A man may indeed hear from those concerning My coming, but he must not henceforth drink from others, but from Me.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:50
verses.text: Therefore let us also, when we come to the feast, no longer come as to old shadows, for they are accomplished, neither as to common feasts, but let us hasten as to the Lord, Who is Himself the feast, not looking upon it as an indulgence and delight of the belly, but as a manifestation of virtue.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:51
verses.text: For the feasts of the heathen are full of greediness, and utter indolence, since they consider they celebrate a feast when they are idle; and they work the works of perdition when they feast.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:52
verses.text: But our feasts consist in the exercise of virtue and the practice of temperance; as the prophetic word testifies in a certain place, saying, 'The fast of the fourth, and the fast of the fifth, and the fast of the seventh, and the fast of the tenth [month], shall be to the house of Judah for gladness, and rejoicing, and for pleasant feasts.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:53
verses.text: ' Since therefore this occasion for exercise is set before us, and such a day as this is come, and the prophetic voice has gone forth that the feast shall be celebrated, let us give all diligence to this good proclamation, and like those who contend on the race course, let us vie with each other in observing the purity of the fast, by watchfulness in prayers, by study of the Scriptures, by distributing to the poor, and let us be at peace with our enemies.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:54
verses.text: Let us bind up those who are scattered abroad, banish pride, and return to lowliness of mind, being at peace with all men, and urging the brethren unto love.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:55
verses.text: Thus also the blessed Paul was often engaged in fastings and watchings, and was willing to be accursed for his brethren.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:56
verses.text: Blessed David again, having humbled himself by fastings, used boldness, saying, 'O Lord my God, if I have done this, if there is any iniquity in my hands, if I have repaid those who dealt evil with me, then may I fall from my enemies as a vain man.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:57
verses.text: ' If we do these things, we shall conquer death; and receive an earnest of the kingdom of heaven.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:58
verses.text: We begin the holy Easter feast on the tenth of Pharmuthi (April ), desisting from the holy fasts on the fifteenth of the same month Pharmuthi (April ), on the evening of the seventh day.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:59
verses.text: And let us keep the holy feast on the sixteenth of the same month Pharmuthi (April ); adding one by one [the days] till the holy Pentecost, passing on to which, as through a succession of feasts, let us keep the festival to the Spirit, Who is even now near us, in Jesus Christ, through Whom and with Whom to the Father be glory and dominion for ever and ever, Amen.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 13:60
verses.text: The fifteenth and sixteenth are wanting.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 14:9
verses.text: Athanasius to the Presbyters and Deacons of Alexandria, and to the beloved brethren, greeting in Christ.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 14:10
verses.text: According to custom, I give you notice respecting Easter, my beloved, that you also may notify the same to the districts of those who are at a distance, as is usual.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 14:11
verses.text: Therefore, after this present festival, I mean this which is on the twentieth of the month Pharmuthi, the Easter-day following will be on the vii Id.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 14:12
verses.text: April, or according to the Alexandrians on the twelfth of Pharmuthi.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 14:13
verses.text: Give notice therefore in all those districts, that Easter-day will be on the vii Id.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 14:14

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 14:15
verses.text: That you may be in health in Christ, I pray, my beloved brethren.
