verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 15:9
verses.text: Athanasius, to the Presbyters and Deacons of Alexandria, brethren beloved in the Lord, greeting.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 15:10
verses.text: You have done well, dearly beloved brethren, that you have given the customary notice of the holy Easter in those districts; for I have seen and acknowledged your exactness.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 15:11
verses.text: By other letters I have also given you notice, that when this year is finished, ye may know concerning the next.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 15:12
verses.text: Yet now I have thought it necessary to write the same things that, when you have it exactly, you also may write with care.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 15:13
verses.text: Therefore, after the conclusion of this feast, which is now drawing to its close, on the twelfth of the month Pharmuthi, which is on the vii Id.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 15:14
verses.text: Apr.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 15:15
verses.text: , Easter-day will be on the iii Kal, April; the fourth of Pharmuthi, according to the Alexandrians.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 15:16
verses.text: When therefore the feast is finished, give notice again in these districts, according to early custom, thus: Easter Sunday is on the iii Kal.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 15:17
verses.text: April, which is the fourth of Pharmuthi, according to the Alexandrian reckoning.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 15:18
verses.text: And let no man hesitate concerning the day, neither let any one contend, saying, It is requisite that Easter should be held on the twenty-seventh of the month Phamenoth; for it was discussed in the holy Synod, and all there settled it to be on the iii Kal.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 15:19
verses.text: April.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 15:20
verses.text: I say then that it is on the fourth of the month Pharmuthi; for the week before this is much too early.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 15:21
verses.text: Therefore let there be no dispute, but let us act as becometh us.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 15:22
verses.text: For I have thus written to the Romans also.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 15:23
verses.text: Give notice then as it has been notified to you, that it is on the iii Kal.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 15:24
verses.text: April; the fourth of Pharmuthi, according to the Alexandrian reckoning.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 15:25
verses.text: That ye may have health in the Lord, I pray, my dearly beloved brethren.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:11
verses.text: 'Blessed is God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ,' for such an introduction is fitting for an Epistle, and more especially now, when it brings thanksgiving to the Lord, in the Apostle's words, because He hath brought us from a distance, and granted us again to send openly to you, as usual, the Festal Letters.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:12
verses.text: For this is the season of the feast, my brethren, and it is near; being not now proclaimed by trumpets, as the history records, but being made known and brought near to us by the Saviour, Who suffered on our behalf and rose again, even as Paul preached, saying, 'Our Passover, Christ, is sacrificed.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:13
verses.text: ' Henceforth the feast of the Passover is ours, not that of a stranger, nor is it any longer of the Jews.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:14
verses.text: For the time of shadows is abolished, and those former things have ceased, and now the month of new things is at hand, in which every man should keep the feast, in obedience to Him who said, 'Observe the month of new things, and keep the Passover to the Lord thy God.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:15
verses.text: ' Even the heathen fancy they keep festival, and the Jews hypo-critically feign to do so.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:16
verses.text: But the feast of the heathen He reproves, as the bread of mourners, and He turns His face from that of the Jews, as being outcasts, saying, 'Your new moons and your sabbaths My soul hateth.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:18
verses.text: For actions not done lawfully and piously, are not of advantage, though they may be reputed to be so, but they rather argue hypocrisy in those who venture upon them.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:19
verses.text: Therefore, although such persons feign to offer sacrifices, yet they hear from the Father, 'Your whole burnt-offerings are not acceptable, and your sacrifices do not please Me; and although ye bring fine flour, it is vanity, incense also is an abomination unto Me.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:20
verses.text: ' For God does not need anything; and, since nothing is unclean to Him, He is full in regard to them, as He testifies, by Isaiah, saying, 'I am full.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:21
verses.text: ' Now there was a law given about these things, for the instruction of the people, and to prefigure things to come, for Paul saith to the Galatians; 'Before faith came, we were kept guarded under the law, being shut up in the faith which should afterwards be revealed unto us; wherefore the law was our instructor in Christ, that we might be justified by faith.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:22
verses.text: ' But the Jews knew not, neither did they understand, therefore they walked in the daytime as in darkness, feeling for, but not touching, the truth we possess, which [was contained] in the law; conforming to the letter, but not submitting to the spirit.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:23
verses.text: And when Moses was veiled, they looked on him, but turned away their faces from him when he was uncovered.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:24
verses.text: For they knew not what they read, but erroneously substituted one thing for another.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:25
verses.text: The prophet, therefore, cried against them, saying, 'Falsehood and faithlessness have prevailed among them.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:26
verses.text: ' The Lord also therefore said concerning them, 'The strange children have dealt falsely with Me; the strange children have waxen old.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:27
verses.text: ' But how gently does He reprove them, saying, 'Had ye believed Moses, ye would have believed Me, for he wrote of Me.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:28
verses.text: ' But being faithless, they went on to deal falsely with the law, affirming things after their own pleasure, but not understanding the Scripture; and, further, as they had hypocritically made a pretence of the plain text of Scripture, and had confidence in this, He is angry with them, saying by Isaiah, 'Who hath required these of your hands?' And by Jeremiah, since they were very bold, he threatens, 'Gather together your whole burnt-offerings with your sacrifices, and eat flesh, for I spake not unto your fathers, nor commanded them in the day that I brought them out of the land of Egypt, concerning whole burnt-offerings and sacrifices.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:29
verses.text: ' For they did not act as was right, neither was their zeal according to law, but they rather sought their own pleasure in such days, as the prophet accuses them, beating down their bondsmen, and gathering themselves together for strifes and quarrels, and they smote the lowly with the fist, and did all things that tended to their own gratification.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:30
verses.text: For this cause, they continue without a feast until the end, although they make a display now of eating flesh, out of place and out of season.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:31
verses.text: For, instead of the legally-appointed lamb, they have learned to sacrifice to Baal; instead of the true unleavened bread, 'they collect the wood, and their fathers kindle the fire, and their wives prepare the dough, that they may make cakes to the host of heaven, and pour out libations to strange gods, that they may provoke Me to anger, saith the Lord.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:32
verses.text: ' They have the just reward of such devices, since, although they pretend to keep the Passover, yet joy and gladness is taken from their mouth, as saith Jeremiah, 'There hath been taken away from the cities of Judah, and the streets of Jerusalem, the voice of those who are glad, and the voice of those who rejoice; the voice of the bridegroom, and the voice of the bride.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:33
verses.text: ' Therefore now, 'he who among them sacrificeth an ox, is as he who smiteth a man, and he who sacrificeth a lamb is as he who killeth a dog, he that offereth fine flour, is as [if he offered] swine's blood, he that giveth frankincense for a memorial, is as a blasphemer.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:34
verses.text: ' Now these things will never please God, neither thus hath the word required of them.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:35
verses.text: But He saith, 'These have chosen their own ways; and their abominations are what their soul delighteth in.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:37
verses.text: And what does this mean my brethren? For it is right for us to investigate the saying of the prophet, and especially on account of heretics who have turned their mind against the law.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:38
verses.text: By Moses then, God gave commandment respecting sacrifices, and all the book called Leviticus is entirely taken up with the arrangement of these matters, so that He might accept the offerer.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:39
verses.text: So through the Prophets, He blames him who despised these things, as disobedient to the commandment saying, 'I have not required these at your hands.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:40
verses.text: Neither did I speak to your fathers respecting sacrifices, nor command them concerning whole burnt-offerings.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:41
verses.text: ' Now it is the opinion of some, that the Scriptures do not agree together, or that God, Who gave the commandment, is false.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:42
verses.text: But there is no disagreement whatever, far from it, neither can the Father, Who is truth, lie; 'for it is impossible that God should lie,' as Paul affirms.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:43
verses.text: But all these things are plain to those who rightly consider them, and to those who receive with faith the writings of the law.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:44
verses.text: Now it appears to me—may God grant, by your prayers, that the remarks I presume to make may not be far from the truth—that not at first were the commandment and the law concerning sacrifices, neither did the mind of God, Who gave the law, regard whole burnt-offerings, but those things which were pointed out and prefigured by them.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:45
verses.text: 'For the law contained a shadow of good things to come.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:46
verses.text: ' And, 'Those things were appointed until the time of reformation.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:48
verses.text: Therefore, the whole law did not treat of sacrifices, though there was in the law a commandment concerning sacrifices, that by means of them it might begin to instruct men and might withdraw them from idols, and bring them near to God, teaching them for that present time.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:49
verses.text: Therefore neither at the beginning, when God brought the people out of Egypt, did He command them concerning sacrifices or whole burnt-offerings, nor even when they came to mount Sinai.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:50
verses.text: For God is not as man, that He should be careful about these things beforehand; but His commandment was given, that they might know Him Who is truly God, and His Word, and might despise those which are falsely called gods, which are not, but appear in outward show.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:51
verses.text: So He made Himself known to them in that He brought them out of Egypt, and caused them to pass through the Red Sea.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:52
verses.text: But when they chose to serve Baal, and dared to offer sacrifices to those that have no existence, and forgot the miracles which were wrought in their behalf in Egypt, and thought of returning thither again; then indeed, after the law, that commandment concerning sacrifices was ordained as law; so that with their mind, which at one time had meditated on those which are not, they might turn to Him Who is truly God, and learn not, in the first place, to sacrifice, but to turn away their faces from idols, and conform to what God commanded.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:53
verses.text: For when He saith, 'I have not spoken concerning sacrifices, neither given commandment concerning whole burnt-offerings,' He immediately adds, 'But this is the thing which I commanded them, saying, Obey My voice, and I will be to you a God, and ye shall be to Me a people, and ye shall walk in all the ways that I command you.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:54
verses.text: ' Thus then, being before instructed and taught, they learned not to do service to any one but the Lord.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:55
verses.text: They attained to know what time the shadow should last, and not to forget the time that was at hand, in which no longer should the bullock of the herd be a sacrifice to God, nor the ram of the flock, nor the he-goat, but all these things should be fulfilled in a purely spiritual manner, and by constant prayer, and upright conversation, with godly words; as David sings, 'May my meditation be pleasing to Him.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:56
verses.text: Let my prayer be set forth before Thee as incense, and the lifting up of my hands as the evening sacrifice.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:57
verses.text: ' The Spirit also, who is in him, commands, saying, 'Offer unto God the sacrifice of praise, and pay to the Lord thy vows.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:58
verses.text: Offer the sacrifice of righteousness, and put your trust in the Lord.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:60
verses.text: Samuel, that great man, no less clearly reproved Saul, saying, 'Is not the word better than a gift?' For hereby a man fulfils the law, and pleases God, as He saith, 'The sacrifice of praise shall glorify Me.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:61
verses.text: ' Let a man 'learn what this means, I will have mercy, and not sacrifice,' and I will not condemn the adversaries.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:62
verses.text: But this wearied them, for they were not anxious to understand, 'for had they known, they would not have crucified the Lord of glory.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:63
verses.text: ' And what their end is, the prophet foretold, crying, 'Woe unto their soul, for they have devised an evil thought, saying, let us bind the just man, because he is not pleasing to us.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:64
verses.text: ' The end of such abandonment as this can be nothing but error, as the Lord, when reproving them, saith, 'Ye do err, not knowing the Scriptures.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:65
verses.text: ' Afterwards when, being reproved, they should have come to their senses, they rather grew insolent, saying, 'We are Moses' disciples; and we know that God spake to Moses;' dealing the more falsely by that very expression, and accusing themselves.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:66
verses.text: For had they believed him to whom they hearkened, they would not have denied the Lord, Who spake by Moses, when He was present.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:67
verses.text: Not so did the eunuch in the Acts, for when he heard, 'Understandest thou what thou readest?' he was not ashamed to confess his ignorance, and implored to be taught.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:68
verses.text: Therefore, to him who became a learner, the grace of the Spirit was given.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:69
verses.text: But as for those Jews who persisted in their ignorance; as the proverb saith, 'Death came upon them.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:70
verses.text: For the fool dies in his sins.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:72
verses.text: Like these too, are the heretics, who, having fallen from true discernment, dare to invent to themselves atheism.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:73
verses.text: 'For the fool saith in his heart, There is no God.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:74
verses.text: They are corrupt, and become abominable in their doings.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:75
verses.text: ' Of such as are fools in their thoughts, the actions are wicked, as He saith, 'can ye, being evil, speak good things;' for they were evil, because they thought wickedness.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:76
verses.text: Or how can those do just acts, whose minds are set upon fraud? Or how shall he love, who is prepared beforehand to hate? How shall he be merciful, who is bent upon the love of money? How shall he be chaste, who looks upon a woman to lust after her? 'For from the heart proceed evil thoughts, fornications, adulteries, murders.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:77
verses.text: ' By them the fool is wrecked, as by the waves of the sea, being led away and enticed by his fleshly pleasures; for this stands written, 'All flesh of fools is greatly tempest-tossed.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:78
verses.text: ' While he associates with folly, he is tossed by a tempest, and perishes, as Solomon says in the Proverbs, 'The fool and he who lacketh understanding shall perish together, and shall leave their wealth to strangers.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:79
verses.text: ' Now they suffer such things, because there is not among them one sound of mind to guide them.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:80
verses.text: For where there is sagacity, there the Word, who is the Pilot of souls, is with the vessel; 'for he that hath understanding shall possess guidance;' but they who are without guidance fall like the leaves.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:81
verses.text: Who has so completely fallen away as Hymenaeus and Philetus, who held evil opinions respecting the resurrection, and concerning faith in it suffered shipwreck? And Judas being a traitor, fell away from the Pilot, and perished with the Jews.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:82
verses.text: But the disciples since they were wise, and therefore remained with the Lord, although the sea was agitated, and the ship covered with the waves, for there was a storm, and the wind was contrary, yet fell not away.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:83
verses.text: For they awoke the Word, Who was sailing with them, and immediately the sea became smooth at the command of its Lord, and they were saved.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:84
verses.text: They became preachers and teachers at the same time; relating the miracles of our Saviour, and teaching us also to imitate their example.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:85
verses.text: These things were written on our account and for our profit, so that through these signs we may acknowledge the Lord Who wrought them.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:86
verses.text: Let us, therefore, in the faith of the disciples, hold frequent converse with our Master.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:87
verses.text: For the world is like the sea to us, my brethren, of which it is written, 'This is the great and wide sea, there go the ships; the Leviathan, which Thou hast created to play therein.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:88
verses.text: ' We float on this sea, as with the wind, through our own free-will, for every one directs his course according to his will, and either, under the pilotage of the Word, he enters into rest, or, laid hold on by pleasure, he suffers shipwreck, and is in peril by storm.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:89
verses.text: For as in the ocean there are storms and waves, so in the world there are many afflictions and trials.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:90
verses.text: The unbelieving therefore 'when affliction or persecution ariseth is offended,' as the Lord said.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:91
verses.text: For not being confirmed in the faith, and having his regard towards temporal things, he cannot resist the difficulties which arise from afflictions.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:92
verses.text: But like that house, built on the sand by the foolish man, so he, being without understanding, falls before the assault of temptations, as it were by the winds.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:93
verses.text: But the saints, having their senses exercised in self-possession, and being strong in faith, and understanding the word, do not faint under trials; but although, from time to time, circumstances of greater trial are set against them, yet they continue faithful, and awaking the Lord Who is with them, they are delivered.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:94
verses.text: So, passing through water and fire, they find relief and duly keep the feast, offering up prayers with thanksgiving to God Who has redeemed them.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:95
verses.text: For either being tempted they are known, like Abraham, or suffering they are approved, like Job, or being oppressed and deceitfully treated, like Joseph, they patiently endure it, or being persecuted, they are not overtaken; but as it is written, through God they 'leap over the wall' of wickedness, which divides and separates between brethren, and turns them from the truth.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:96
verses.text: In this manner the blessed Paul, when he took pleasure in infirmities, in reproach, in necessities, in persecutions, and in distresses for Christ, rejoiced, and wished all of us to rejoice saying, 'Rejoice always; in everything give thanks.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:98
verses.text: For what is so fitting for the feast, a turning from wickedness, and a pure conversation, and prayer offered without ceasing to God, with thanksgiving? Therefore let us, my brethren, looking forward to celebrate the eternal joy in heaven, keep the feast here also, rejoicing at all times, praying incessantly, and in everything giving thanks to the Lord.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:99
verses.text: I give thanks to God, for those other wonders He has done, and for the various helps that have now been granted us, in that though He hath chastened us sore, He did not deliver us over to death, but brought us from a distance even as from the ends of the earth, and hath united us again with you.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:100
verses.text: I have been mindful while I keep the feast, to give you also notice of the great feast of Easter, that so we may go up together, as it were, to Jerusalem, and eat the Passover, not separately but as in one house; let us not as sodden in water, water down the word of God; neither let us, as having broken its bones, destroy the commands of the Gospel.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:101
verses.text: But as roasted with fire, with bitterness, being fervent in spirit, in fastings and watchings, with lying on the ground, let us keep it with penitence and thanksgiving.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:102
verses.text: We begin the fast of forty days on the sixth day of Phamenoth (Mar.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:103
verses.text: ); and having passed through that properly, with fasting and prayers, we may be able to attain to the holy day.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:104
verses.text: For he who neglects to observe the fast of forty days, as one who rashly and impurely treads on holy things, cannot celebrate the Easter festival.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:105
verses.text: Further, let us put one another in remembrance, and stimulate one another not to be negligent, and especially that we should fast those days, so that fasts may receive us in succession, and we may rightly bring the feast to a close.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:106
verses.text: The fast of forty days begins then, as was already said, on the sixth of Phamenoth (Mar.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:107
verses.text: ), and the great week of the Passion on the eleventh of Pharmuthi (Apr.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:109
verses.text: And let us rest from the fast on the sixteenth of it (Apr.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:110
verses.text: ), on the seventh day, late in the evening.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:111
verses.text: Let us keep the feast when the first of the week dawns upon us, on the seventeenth of the same month Pharmuthi (Apr.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:113
verses.text: Let us then add, one after the other, the seven holy weeks of Pentecost, rejoicing and praising God, that He hath by these things made known to us beforehand, joy and rest everlasting, prepared in heaven for us and for those who truly believe in Christ Jesus our Lord; through Whom, and with Whom, be glory and dominion to the Father, with the Holy Ghost, for ever and ever, Amen.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:114
verses.text: Salute one another with a holy kiss.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:115
verses.text: The brethren who are with me salute you.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:116
verses.text: I have also thought it necessary to inform you of the appointment of Bishops, which has taken place in the stead of our blessed fellow-ministers, that ye may know to whom to write, and from whom ye should receive letters.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:117
verses.text: In Syene, therefore, Nilammon, instead of Nilammon of the same name.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:118
verses.text: In Latopolis, Masis, instead of Ammonius.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:119
verses.text: In Coptos, Psenosiris, instead of Theodorus.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:120
verses.text: In Panopolis, because Artemidorus desired it, on account of his old age, and weakness of body, Arius is appointed coadjutor.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:121
verses.text: In Hypsele, Arsenius, having become reconciled to the Church.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:122
verses.text: In Lycopolis, Eudaemon in the stead of Plusianus.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:123
verses.text: In Antinoöpolis, Arion, instead of Ammonius and Tyrannus.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:124
verses.text: In Oxyrynchus, Theodorus, instead of Pelagius.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:125
verses.text: In Nilopolis, instead of Theon, Amatus, and Isaac, who are reconciled to each other.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:126
verses.text: In Arsenoitis, Andreas , instead of Silvanus.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:127
verses.text: In Prosopitis, Triadelphus, instead of Serapammon.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:128
verses.text: In Diosphacus, on the river side, Theodorus, instead of Serapammon.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:129
verses.text: In Sais, Paphnutius, instead of Nemesion.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:130
verses.text: In Xois, Theodorus, instead of Anubion; and there is also with him Isidorus, who is reconciled to the Church.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:131
verses.text: In Sethroitis, Orion, instead of Potammon.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 16:132
verses.text: In Clysma, Tithonas, instead of Jacob; and there is with him Paulus, who has been reconciled to the Church.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:1
verses.text: Letter XX.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:2
verses.text: —(For.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:3
verses.text: ) Coss.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:4
verses.text: Philippus, Salia; Praefect the same Nestorius; Indict.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:5
verses.text: vi; Easter-day iii Non.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:6
verses.text: Apr.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:7
verses.text: , viii Pharmuthi; aera Dioclet.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:8
verses.text: ; Moon.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:9
verses.text: Let us now keep the feast, my brethren, for as our Lord then gave notice to His disciples, so He now tells us beforehand, that 'after some days is the Passover,' in which the Jews indeed betrayed the Lord, but we celebrate His death as a feast, rejoicing because we then obtained rest from our afflictions.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:10
verses.text: We are diligent in assembling ourselves together, for we were scattered in time past and were lost, and are found.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:11
verses.text: We were far off, and are brought nigh, we were strangers, and have become His, Who suffered for us, and was nailed on the cross, Who bore our sins, as the prophet saith, and was afflicted for us, that He might put away from all of us grief, and sorrow, and sighing.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:12
verses.text: When we thirst, He satisfies us on the feast-day itself; standing and crying, 'If any man thirst, let him come to Me, and drink.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:13
verses.text: ' For such is the love of the saints at all times, that they never once leave off, but offer the uninterrupted, constant sacrifice to the Lord, and continually thirst, and ask of Him to drink; as David sang, 'My God, my God, early will I seek Thee, my soul thirsteth for Thee; many times my heart and flesh longeth for Thee in a barren land, without a path, and without water.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:14
verses.text: Thus was I seen by Thee in the sanctuary.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:15
verses.text: ' And Isaiah the prophet says, 'From the night my spirit seeketh Thee early, O God, because Thy commandments are light.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:16
verses.text: ' And another says, 'My soul fainteth for the longing it hath for Thy judgments at all times.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:17
verses.text: ' And again he says, 'For Thy judgments I have hoped, and Thy law will I keep at all times.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:18
verses.text: ' Another boldly cries out, saying, 'Mine eye is ever towards the Lord.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:19
verses.text: ' And with him one says, 'The meditation of my heart is before Thee at all times.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:20
verses.text: ' And Paul further advises, 'At all times give thanks; pray without ceasing.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:21
verses.text: ' Those who are thus continually engaged, are waiting entirely on the Lord, and say, 'Let us follow on to know the Lord: we shall find Him ready as the morning, and He will come to us as the early and the latter rain for the earth.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:22
verses.text: ' For not only does He satisfy them in the morning; neither does He give them only as much to drink as they ask; but He gives them abundantly according to the multitude of His lovingkindness, vouchsafing to them at all times the grace of the Spirit.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:23
verses.text: And what it is they thirst for He immediately adds, saying, 'He that believeth on Me.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:24
verses.text: ' For, 'as cold waters are pleasant to those who are thirsty,' according to the proverb, so to those who believe in the Lord, the coming of the Spirit is better than all refreshment and delight.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:25
verses.text: It becomes us then in these days of the Passover, to rise early with the saints, and approach the Lord with all our soul, with purity of body, with confession and godly faith in Him; so that when we have here first drunk, and are filled with these divine waters which [flow] from Him, we may be able to sit at table with the saints in heaven, and may share in the one voice of gladness which is there.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:26
verses.text: From this sinners, because it wearied them, are rightly cast out, and hear the words, 'Friend, how camest thou in hither, not having a wedding garment?' Sinners indeed thirst, but not for the grace of the Spirit; but being inflamed with wickedness, they are wholly set on fire by pleasures, as saith the Proverb, 'All day long he desires evil desires.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:27
verses.text: ' But the Prophet cries against them, saying, 'Wo unto those who rise up early, and follow strong drink; who continue until the evening, for wine inflameth them.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:28
verses.text: ' And since they run wild in wantonness, they dare to thirst for the destruction of others.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:29
verses.text: Having first drunk of lying and unfaithful waters, those things have come upon them, which are stated by the Prophet; 'My wound,' saith he, 'is grievous, whence shall I be healed; it hath surely been to me like deceitful waters, in which there is no trust.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:30
verses.text: ' Secondly, while they drink with their companions, they lead astray and disturb the right mind, and turn away the simple from it.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:31
verses.text: And what does he cry? 'Wo unto him who causeth his neighbour to drink turbid destruction, and maketh him drunk, that he may look upon his caverns.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:32
verses.text: ' But those who dissemble, and steal away the truth, quench their hearts.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:33
verses.text: Having first drunk of these things, they go on to say those things which the whore saith in the Proverbs, 'Lay hold with delight on hidden bread, and sweet stolen waters.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:34
verses.text: ' They lay snares secretly, because they have not the freedom of virtue, nor the boldness of Wisdom, who praises herself in the gates, and employs freedom of speech in the broad ways, preaching on high walls.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:35
verses.text: For this reason, they are bidden to 'lay hold with delight,' because, having the choice between faith and pleasures, they steal the sweetness of truth, and disguise their own bitter waters [to escape] from the blame of their wickedness, which would have been speedy and public.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:36
verses.text: On this account, the wolf puts on the skin of the sheep, sepulchres deceive by their whitened exteriors.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 17:37
verses.text: Satan, that is….

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 18:1
verses.text: From Letter XXII.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 18:2
verses.text: —(For.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 18:3
verses.text: )  Where our Lord Jesus Christ, who took upon Him to die for all, stretched forth His hands, not somewhere on the earth beneath, but in the air itself, in order that the Salvation effected by the Cross might be shewn to be for all men everywhere: destroying the devil who was working in the air: and that He might consecrate our road up to Heaven, and make it free.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 19:1
verses.text: From Letter XXIV.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 19:2
verses.text: —(For.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 19:3
verses.text: )  And at that time when they went forth and crossed over Egypt, their enemies were the sport of the sea; but now, when we pass over from earth to Heaven, Satan himself henceforth falls like lightning from Heaven.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 20:1
verses.text: From Letter XXVII.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 20:2
verses.text: —(For.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 20:3
verses.text: ) From the twenty-seventh Festal Letter of Athanasius, Bishop of Alexandria and Confessor; of which the commencement is, 'Again the season of the day of the living Passover.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 20:4
verses.text: '  For who is our joy and boast, but our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ, Who suffered for us, and by Himself made known to us the Father? For He is no other than He Who of old time spoke by the Prophets; but now He saith to every man, 'I Who speak am near.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 20:5
verses.text: ' Right well is this word spoken, for He does not at one time speak, at another keep silence; but continually and at all times, from the beginning without ceasing, He raises up every man, and speaks to every man in his heart.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 21:1
verses.text: From Letter XXVIII.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 21:2
verses.text: —(For.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 21:3
verses.text: )  …In order that while He might become a sacrifice for us all, we, nourished up in the words of truth, and partaking of His living doctrine, might be able with the saints to receive also the joy of Heaven.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 21:4
verses.text: For thither, as He called the disciples to the upper chamber, so does the Word call us with them to the divine and incorruptible banquet; having suffered for us here, but there, preparing the heavenly tabernacles for those who most readily hearken to the summons, and unceasingly, and [gazing] at the goal, pursue the prize of their high calling; where for them who come to the banquet, and strive with those who hinder them, there is laid up both a crown, and incorruptible joy.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 21:5
verses.text: For even though, humanly speaking, the labour of such a journey is great, yet the Saviour Himself has rendered even it light and kindly.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 22:1
verses.text: Another Fragment.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 22:2
verses.text: But let us, brethren, who have received the vineyard from the Saviour, and are invited to the heavenly banquet, inasmuch as the Feast is now drawing nigh, take the branches of the palm trees, and proving conquerors of sin, let us too like those, who on that occasion went to meet the Saviour, make ourselves ready by our conduct, both to meet Him when He comes, and to go in with Him and partake of the immortal food, and from thenceforth live eternally in the heavens.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 23:1
verses.text: From Letter XXIX.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 23:2
verses.text: —(For.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 23:3
verses.text: ) From the twenty-ninth Letter, of which the beginning is, 'Sufficient for this present time is that which we have already written.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 23:4
verses.text: '  The Lord proved the disciples, when He was asleep on the pillow, at which time a miracle was wrought, which is especially calculated to put even the wicked to shame.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 23:5
verses.text: For when He arose, and rebuked the sea, and silenced the storm, He plainly shewed two things; that the storm of the sea was not from the winds, but from fear of its Lord Who walked upon it, and that the Lord Who rebuked it was not a creature, but rather its Creator, since a creature is not obedient to another creature.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 23:6
verses.text: For although the Red Sea was divided before by Moses, yet it was not Moses who did it, for it came to pass, not because he spoke, but because God commanded.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 23:7
verses.text: And if the sun stood still in Gibeon, and the moon in the valley of Ajalon, yet this was the work, not of the son of Nun, but of the Lord, Who heard his prayer.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 23:8
verses.text: He it was Who both rebuked the sea, and on the cross caused the sun to be darkened.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 24:1
verses.text: Another Fragment.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 24:2
verses.text: And whereas what is human comes to an end, what is divine does not.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 24:3
verses.text: For which reason also when we are dead, and when our nature is tired out, he raises us up, and leads us up [though] born of earth to heaven.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 25:1
verses.text: Another Fragment.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 25:2
verses.text: Here begins a letter of S.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 25:3
verses.text: Athanasius, Bishop of Alexandria, to his children.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 25:4
verses.text: May God comfort you.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 25:5
verses.text: I know moreover that not only this thing saddens you, but also the fact that while others have obtained the churches by violence, you are meanwhile cast out from your places.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 25:6
verses.text: For they hold the places, but you the Apostolic Faith.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 25:7
verses.text: They are, it is true, in the places, but outside of the true Faith; while you are outside the places indeed, but the Faith, within you.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 25:8
verses.text: Let us consider whether is the greater, the place or the Faith.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 25:9
verses.text: Clearly the true Faith.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 25:10
verses.text: Who then has lost more, or who possesses more? He who holds the place, or he who holds the Faith? Good indeed is the place, when the Apostolic Faith is preached there, holy is it if the Holy One dwell there.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 25:11
verses.text: (After a little:) But ye are blessed, who by faith are in the Church, dwell upon the foundations of the faith, and have full satisfaction, even the highest degree of faith which remains among you unshaken.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 25:12
verses.text: For it has come down to you from Apostolic tradition, and frequently has accursed envy wished to unsettle it, but has not been able.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 25:13
verses.text: On the contrary, they have rather been cut off by their attempts to do so.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 25:14
verses.text: For this is it that is written, 'Thou art the Son of the Living God,' Peter confessing it by revelation of the Father, and being told, 'Blessed art thou Simon Barjona, for flesh and blood did not reveal it to thee,' but 'My Father Who is in heaven,' and the rest.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 25:15
verses.text: No one therefore will ever prevail against your Faith, most beloved brethren.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 25:16
verses.text: For if ever God shall give back the churches (for we think He will) yet without such restoration of the churches the Faith is sufficient for us.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 25:17
verses.text: And lest, speaking without the Scriptures, I should [seem to] speak too strongly, it is well to bring you to the testimony of Scriptures, for recollect that the Temple indeed was at Jerusalem; the Temple was not deserted, aliens had invaded it, whence also the Temple being at Jerusalem, those exiles went down to Babylon by the judgment of God, who was proving, or rather correcting them; while manifesting to them in their ignorance punishment [by means] of blood-thirsty enemies.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 25:18
verses.text: And aliens indeed had held the Place, but knew not the Lord of the Place, while in that He neither gave answer nor spoke, they were deserted by the truth.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 25:19
verses.text: What profit then is the Place to them?  For behold they that hold the Place are charged by them that love God with making it a den of thieves, and with madly making the Holy Place a house of merchandise, and a house of judicial business for themselves to whom it was unlawful to enter there.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 25:20
verses.text: For this and worse than this is what we have heard, most beloved, from those who are come from thence.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 25:21
verses.text: However really, then, they seem to hold the church, so much the more truly are they cast out.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 25:22
verses.text: And they think themselves to be within the truth, but are exiled, and in captivity, and [gain] no advantage by the church alone.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 25:23
verses.text: For the truth of things is judged….

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:1
verses.text: From Letter XXXIX.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:2
verses.text: —(For.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:3
verses.text: ) Of the particular books and their number, which are accepted by the Church.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:4
verses.text: From the thirty-ninth Letter of Holy Athanasius, Bishop of Alexandria, on the Paschal festival; wherein he defines canonically what are the divine books which are accepted by the Church.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:6
verses.text: They have fabricated books which they call books of tables, in which they shew stars, to which they give the names of Saints.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:7
verses.text: And therein of a truth they have inflicted on themselves a double reproach: those who have written such books, because they have perfected themselves in a lying and contemptible science; and as to the ignorant and simple, they have led them astray by evil thoughts concerning the right faith established in all truth and upright in the presence of God.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:9
verses.text: But since we have made mention of heretics as dead, but of ourselves as possessing the Divine Scriptures for salvation; and since I fear lest, as Paul wrote to the Corinthians, some few of the simple should be beguiled from their simplicity and purity, by the subtilty of certain men, and should henceforth read other books—those called apocryphal—led astray by the similarity of their names with the true books; I beseech you to bear patiently, if I also write, by way of remembrance, of matters with which you are acquainted, influenced by the need and advantage of the Church.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:10
verses.text: In proceeding to make mention of these things, I shall adopt, to commend my undertaking, the pattern of Luke the Evangelist, saying on my own account: 'Forasmuch as some have taken in hand,' to reduce into order for themselves the books termed apocryphal, and to mix them up with the divinely inspired Scripture, concerning which we have been fully persuaded, as they who from the beginning were eyewitnesses and ministers of the Word, delivered to the fathers; it seemed good to me also, having been urged thereto by true brethren, and having learned from the beginning, to set before you the books included in the Canon, and handed down, and accredited as Divine; to the end that any one who has fallen into error may condemn those who have led him astray; and that he who has continued stedfast in purity may again rejoice, having these things brought to his remembrance.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:11
verses.text: There are, then, of the Old Testament, twenty-two books in number; for, as I have heard, it is handed down that this is the number of the letters among the Hebrews; their respective order and names being as follows.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:12
verses.text: The first is Genesis, then Exodus, next Leviticus, after that Numbers, and then Deuteronomy.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:13
verses.text: Following these there is Joshua, the son of Nun, then Judges, then Ruth.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:14
verses.text: And again, after these four books of Kings, the first and second being reckoned as one book, and so likewise the third and fourth as one book.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:15
verses.text: And again, the first and second of the Chronicles are reckoned as one book.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:16
verses.text: Again Ezra, the first and second are similarly one book.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:17
verses.text: After these there is the book of Psalms, then the Proverbs, next Ecclesiastes, and the Song of Songs.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:18
verses.text: Job follows, then the Prophets, the twelve being reckoned as one book.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:19
verses.text: Then Isaiah, one book, then Jeremiah with Baruch, Lamentations, and the epistle, one book; afterwards, Ezekiel and Daniel, each one book.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:20
verses.text: Thus far constitutes the Old Testament.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:21
verses.text: Again it is not tedious to speak of the [books] of the New Testament.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:22
verses.text: These are, the four Gospels, according to Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:23
verses.text: Afterwards, the Acts of the Apostles and Epistles (called Catholic), seven, viz.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:24
verses.text: of James, one; of Peter, two; of John, three; after these, one of Jude.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:25
verses.text: In addition, there are fourteen Epistles of Paul, written in this order.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:26
verses.text: The first, to the Romans; then two to the Corinthians; after these, to the Galatians; next, to the Ephesians; then to the Philippians; then to the Colossians; after these, two to the Thessalonians, and that to the Hebrews; and again, two to Timothy; one to Titus; and lastly, that to Philemon.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:27
verses.text: And besides, the Revelation of John.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:28
verses.text: These are fountains of salvation, that they who thirst may be satisfied with the living words they contain.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:29
verses.text: In these alone is proclaimed the doctrine of godliness.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:30
verses.text: Let no man add to these, neither let him take ought from these.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:31
verses.text: For concerning these the Lord put to shame the Sadducees, and said, 'Ye do err, not knowing the Scriptures.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:32
verses.text: ' And He reproved the Jews, saying, 'Search the Scriptures, for these are they that testify of Me.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:34
verses.text: But for greater exactness I add this also, writing of necessity; that there are other books besides these not indeed included in the Canon, but appointed by the Fathers to be read by those who newly join us, and who wish for instruction in the word of godliness.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:35
verses.text: The Wisdom of Solomon, and the Wisdom of Sirach, and Esther, and Judith, and Tobit, and that which is called the Teaching of the Apostles, and the Shepherd.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:36
verses.text: But the former, my brethren, are included in the Canon, the latter being [merely] read; nor is there in any place a mention of apocryphal writings.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 26:37
verses.text: But they are an invention of heretics, who write them when they choose, bestowing upon them their approbation, and assigning to them a date, that so, using them as ancient writings, they may find occasion to lead astray the simple.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 27:1
verses.text: From Letter XL.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 27:2
verses.text: —(For.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 27:3
verses.text: )  'Ye are they that have continued with Me in My temptations; and I appoint unto you a kingdom, as My Father hath appointed unto Me, that ye may eat and drink at My table in My kingdom.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 27:4
verses.text: ' Being called, then, to the great and heavenly Supper, in that upper room which has been swept, let us 'cleanse ourselves,' as the Apostle exhorted, 'from all filthiness of the flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in the fear of God;' that so, being spotless within and without,—without, clothing ourselves with temperance and justice; within, by the Spirit, rightly dividing the word of truth—we may hear, 'Enter into the joy of thy Lord.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 28:1
verses.text: From Letter XLII.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 28:2
verses.text: —(For.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 28:3
verses.text: )  For we have been called, brethren, and are now called together, by Wisdom, and according to the Evangelical parable, to that great and heavenly Supper, and sufficient for every creature; I mean, to the Passover,—to Christ, Who is sacrificed; for 'Christ our Passover is sacrificed.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 28:4
verses.text: ' (And afterwards:) They, therefore, that are thus prepared shall hear, 'Enter into the joy of thy Lord.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 29:1
verses.text: From Letter XLIII.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 29:2
verses.text: —(For.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 29:3
verses.text: )  Of us, then, whose also is the Passover, the calling is from above, and 'our conversation is in heaven,' as Paul says; 'For we have here no abiding city, but we seek that which is to come,' whereto, also, looking forward, we properly keep the feast.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 29:4
verses.text: (And again, afterwards:) Heaven truly is high, and its distance from us infinite; for 'the heaven of heavens,' says he, 'is the Lord's.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 29:5
verses.text: ' But not, on that account, are we to be negligent or fearful, as though the way thereto were impossible; but rather should we be zealous.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 29:6
verses.text: Yet not, as in the case of those who formerly, removing from the east and finding a plain in Senaar, began [to build a tower], is there need for us to bake bricks with fire, and to seek slime for mortar; for their tongues were confounded, and their work was destroyed.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 29:7
verses.text: But for us the Lord has consecrated a way through His blood, and has made it easy.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 29:8
verses.text: (And again:) For not only has He afforded us consolation respecting the distance, but also in that He has come and opened the door for us which was once shut.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 29:9
verses.text: For, indeed, it was shut from the time He cast out Adam from the delight of Paradise, and set the Cherubim and the flaming sword, that turned every way, to keep the way of the tree of life—now, however, opened wide.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 29:10
verses.text: And He that sitteth upon the Cherubim having appeared with greater grace and loving-kindness, led into Paradise with himself the thief who confessed, and having entered heaven as our forerunner, opened the gates to all.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 29:11
verses.text: (And again:) Paul also, 'pressing toward the mark for the prize of the high calling,' by it was taken up to the third heaven, and having seen those things which are above, and then descended, he teaches us, announcing what is written to the Hebrews, and saying, 'For ye are not come unto the mount that might be touched, and that burned with fire, and clouds, and darkness, and a tempest, and to the voice of words.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 29:12
verses.text: But ye are come unto Mount Sion, and unto the city of the living God, the heavenly Jerusalem, and to an innumerable company of angels, and to the general assembly and Church of the first-born, which are written in heaven.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 29:13
verses.text: ' Who would not wish to enjoy the high companionship with these! Who not desire to be enrolled with these, that he may hear with them, 'Come, ye blessed of My Father, inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 30:1
verses.text: From Letter XLIV.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 30:2
verses.text: —(For.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 30:3
verses.text: ) And again, from the forty-fourth Letter, of which the commencement is, 'All that our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ did instead of us and for us.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 30:4
verses.text: '  When therefore the servants of the Chief Priests and the Scribes saw these things, and heard from Jesus, 'Whosoever is athirst, let him come to Me and drink;' they perceived that this was not a mere man like themselves, but that this was He Who gave water to the saints, and that it was He Who was announced by the prophet Isaiah.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 30:5
verses.text: For He was truly the splendour of the light, and the Word of God.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 30:6
verses.text: And thus as a river from the fountain he gave drink also of old to Paradise; but now to all men He gives the same gift of the Spirit, and says, 'If any man thirst, let him come to Me and drink.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 30:7
verses.text: ' Whosoever 'believeth on Me, as saith the Scripture, rivers of living water shall flow out of his belly.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 30:8
verses.text: ' This was not for man to say, but for the living God, Who truly vouchsafes life, and gives the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 31:1
verses.text: From Letter XLV.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 31:2
verses.text: —(For.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 31:3
verses.text: )  Let us all take up our sacrifices, observing distribution to the poor, and enter into the holy place, as it is written; 'whither also our forerunner Jesus is entered for us, having obtained eternal redemption.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 31:4
verses.text: '…(From the same:)…And this is a great proof that, whereas we were strangers, we are called friends; from being formerly aliens, we are become fellow-citizens with the saints, and are called children of the Jerusalem which is above, whereof that which Solomon built was a type.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 31:5
verses.text: For if Moses made all things according to the pattern shewed him in the mount, it is clear that the service performed in the tabernacle was a type of the heavenly mysteries, whereto the Lord, desirous that we should enter, prepared for us the new and abiding way.

verses.name: Athanasius: Festal Letters 31:6
verses.text: And as all the old things were a type of the new, so the festival that now is, is a type of the joy which is above, to which coming with psalms and spiritual songs, let us begin the fasts.
